MIT integration bee - 2010

Notación y Consideraciones Generales

A lo largo del documento vamos a utilizar la siguiente notación, en algunos problemas más complejos utilizaremos la notación usual:

{ f(x) }ab:=∫abf(x) dx  ,  [ f(x) ]:=ddxf(x) \{~f(x)~\}_{a}^{b}:= \int_{a}^{b} f(x) ~dx ~~,~~ [~f(x)~]:= \frac{d}{dx}f(x) { f(x) }ab​:=∫ab​f(x) dx  ,  [ f(x) ]:=dxd​f(x)

Recursos obtenidos de: https://math.mit.edu/~yyao1/integrationbee.html

Herramientas que te pueden ser útiles:

  • Calculadora gráfica: https://www.desmos.com/calculator?lang=es
  • Calculadora de integrales: https://mathdf.com/es/
  • Calculadora de integrales: https://www.wolframalpha.com/
  • Motor de busqueda para fórmulas en latex https://approach0.xyz/search/
  • Te ayuda con ideas: https://chat.deepseek.com

Ejercicio 1

∫0π/2sin⁡(x)sin⁡(2x)sin⁡(3x)dx \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \sin(x) \sin(2x) \sin(3x) dx ∫0π/2​sin(x)sin(2x)sin(3x)dx

−−− Demostracioˊn −−−\textcolor{green}{---\text{ Demostración } ---}−−− Demostracioˊn −−−

I={ sin⁡(x)sin⁡(2x)sin⁡(3x) }0π/2=12{ sin⁡(x)(cos⁡(x)−cos⁡(5x)) }0π/2(1)=12({ sin⁡(x)cos⁡(x) }0π/2−{ sin⁡(x)cos⁡(5x) }0π/2)=12((sin⁡2(x)2)0π/2−{ sin⁡(x)cos⁡(5x) }0π/2)=12(12−{ sin⁡(x)cos⁡(5x) }0π/2)=12(12−12{ sin⁡(6x)−sin⁡(4x) }0π/2)(2)=12(12−12( −cos⁡(6x)6+cos⁡(4x)4)0π/2)=12(12−12( 26))=16 \begin{array}{rclr} I &=& \displaystyle \{~ \sin(x) \sin(2x) \sin(3x) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2}\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \{~ \sin(x) (\cos(x) - \cos(5x)) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \left(\{~ \sin(x)\cos(x) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2} - \{~ \sin(x) \cos(5x) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2} \right) \\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \left( \left(\frac{\sin^2(x)}{2} \right)_{0}^{\pi/2} - \{~ \sin(x) \cos(5x) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2} \right) \\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2} - \{~ \sin(x) \cos(5x) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2} \right) \\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2}\{~ \sin(6x) - \sin(4x) ~\}_{0}^{\pi/2} \right) & (2)\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2} \left(~ -\frac{\cos(6x)}{6} + \frac{\cos(4x)}{4} \right)_{0}^{\pi/2} \right) \\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2} \left(~ \frac{2}{6}\right)\right) \\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{6} \end{array} I​=========​{ sin(x)sin(2x)sin(3x) }0π/2​21​{ sin(x)(cos(x)−cos(5x)) }0π/2​21​({ sin(x)cos(x) }0π/2​−{ sin(x)cos(5x) }0π/2​)21​((2sin2(x)​)0π/2​−{ sin(x)cos(5x) }0π/2​)21​(21​−{ sin(x)cos(5x) }0π/2​)21​(21​−21​{ sin(6x)−sin(4x) }0π/2​)21​(21​−21​( −6cos(6x)​+4cos(4x)​)0π/2​)21​(21​−21​( 62​))61​​(1)(2)​

  • (1): sin⁡(x)sin⁡(y)=12(cos⁡(x−y)−cos⁡(x+y))\sin(x)\sin(y) = \frac{1}{2} (\cos(x - y) - \cos(x + y))sin(x)sin(y)=21​(cos(x−y)−cos(x+y))

  • (2): sin⁡(x)cos⁡(y)=12(sin⁡(x−y)+sin⁡(x+y))\sin(x)\cos(y) = \frac{1}{2} (\sin(x - y) + \sin(x + y))sin(x)cos(y)=21​(sin(x−y)+sin(x+y)) y sin⁡(−x)=−sin⁡(x)\sin(-x) = - \sin(x)sin(−x)=−sin(x)

∫π/4π/31sin⁡3xcos⁡5xdx \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \frac{1}{\sin^3 x \cos^5 x} dx ∫π/4π/3​sin3xcos5x1​dx

I={ sin⁡2(x)+cos⁡2(x)sin⁡3(x)cos⁡5(x) }π/4π/3(1)={ 1sin⁡(x)cos⁡5(x)+1sin⁡3(x)cos⁡3(x) }π/4π/3(1)={ sin⁡(x)cos⁡5(x)+1sin⁡(x)cos⁡3(x)+1sin⁡3(x)cos⁡3(x) }π/4π/3(1)={ tan⁡(x)sec⁡4(x)+21sin⁡(x)cos⁡3(x)+1sin⁡3(x)cos⁡(x) }π/4π/3(1)={ tan⁡(x)sec⁡4(x)+2(sin⁡(x)cos⁡3(x)+1sin⁡(x)cos⁡(x))+1sin⁡(x)cos⁡(x)+cos⁡(x)sin⁡3(x) }π/4π/3(1)={ tan⁡(x)sec⁡4(x)+2tan⁡(x)sec⁡2(x)+31sin⁡(x)cos⁡(x)+cot⁡(x)csc⁡2(x) }π/4π/3={ tan⁡(x)sec⁡4(x)+2tan⁡(x)sec⁡2(x)+3(tan⁡(x)+cot⁡(x))+cot⁡(x)csc⁡2(x) }π/4π/3(1)=(tan⁡2(x)2+tan⁡4(x)4)π/4π/3+2(tan⁡2(x)2)π/4π/3+3( −ln⁡(cos⁡(x))+ln⁡(sin⁡(x)) )π/4π/3−(cot⁡2(x)2)π/4π/3=163+32ln⁡(3) \begin{array}{rclr} I &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\sin^2(x) + \cos^2(x)}{\sin^3(x) \cos^5(x)} ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{1}{\sin(x) \cos^5 (x)} + \frac{1}{\sin^3 (x) \cos^3 (x)} ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\sin(x)}{\cos^5 (x)} + \frac{1}{\sin(x) \cos^3 (x)} + \frac{1}{\sin^3 (x) \cos^3 (x)} ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \tan(x)\sec^4(x) + 2 \frac{1}{\sin(x) \cos^3 (x)} + \frac{1}{\sin^3 (x) \cos(x)} ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \tan(x)\sec^4(x) + 2 \left( \frac{\sin(x)}{\cos^3 (x)} + \frac{1}{\sin(x) \cos (x)} \right) + \frac{1}{\sin(x) \cos(x)} +\frac{\cos(x)}{\sin^3 (x)} ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \tan(x)\sec^4(x) + 2 \tan(x) \sec^2(x) + 3 \frac{1}{\sin(x) \cos (x)} + \cot(x)\csc^2(x) ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3}\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \tan(x)\sec^4(x) + 2 \tan(x) \sec^2(x) + 3 \left( \tan(x) + \cot(x) \right) + \cot(x)\csc^2(x) ~\right\}_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left( \frac{\tan^2(x)}{2} + \frac{\tan^4(x)}{4} \right)_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} + 2 \left( \frac{\tan^2(x)}{2}\right)_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} + 3 \left(~ - \ln(\cos(x)) + \ln(\sin(x)) ~\right)_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} - \left( \frac{\cot^2(x)}{2}\right)_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3}\\ &=& \frac{16}{3} + \frac{3}{2} \ln(3) \end{array} I​=========​{ sin3(x)cos5(x)sin2(x)+cos2(x)​ }π/4π/3​{ sin(x)cos5(x)1​+sin3(x)cos3(x)1​ }π/4π/3​{ cos5(x)sin(x)​+sin(x)cos3(x)1​+sin3(x)cos3(x)1​ }π/4π/3​{ tan(x)sec4(x)+2sin(x)cos3(x)1​+sin3(x)cos(x)1​ }π/4π/3​{ tan(x)sec4(x)+2(cos3(x)sin(x)​+sin(x)cos(x)1​)+sin(x)cos(x)1​+sin3(x)cos(x)​ }π/4π/3​{ tan(x)sec4(x)+2tan(x)sec2(x)+3sin(x)cos(x)1​+cot(x)csc2(x) }π/4π/3​{ tan(x)sec4(x)+2tan(x)sec2(x)+3(tan(x)+cot(x))+cot(x)csc2(x) }π/4π/3​(2tan2(x)​+4tan4(x)​)π/4π/3​+2(2tan2(x)​)π/4π/3​+3( −ln(cos(x))+ln(sin(x)) )π/4π/3​−(2cot2(x)​)π/4π/3​316​+23​ln(3)​(1)(1)(1)(1)(1)(1)​

  • (1): cos⁡2(x)+sin⁡2(x)=1\cos^2(x) + \sin^2(x) = 1cos2(x)+sin2(x)=1

Nota:

  1. Tenemos la siguiente fórmula de reducción de potencias:

    cos⁡n(θ)=2−n  ∑k=0n(nk)cos⁡( (2k−n)θ ) \cos^n(\theta) = 2^{-n} ~~ \sum_{k=0}^{n} \binom{n}{k} \cos(~(2k-n) \theta~) cosn(θ)=2−n  k=0∑n​(kn​)cos( (2k−n)θ )

  2. Estudiar la integral I(n,m)={1sin⁡n(θ)cos⁡m(θ)}I(n,m) = \left\{\frac{1}{\sin^n(\theta) \cos^m(\theta)} \right\}I(n,m)={sinn(θ)cosm(θ)1​} mediante la siguiente recursión:

    I(n,m)=I(n−2,m)+I(n,m−2)  ,  para n,m≥2 I(n,m) = I(n-2,m) + I(n,m-2) ~~,~~ \text{para } n,m \geq 2 I(n,m)=I(n−2,m)+I(n,m−2)  ,  para n,m≥2

    Utilizando el metodo de series formales, es decir, estudiando la serie formal en dos variables:

    ∑n,m≥0xnymI(n,m) \sum_{n,m \geq 0} x^n y^m I(n,m) n,m≥0∑​xnymI(n,m)

∫0π/2tan⁡(x) dx \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \sqrt{\tan (x)} ~dx ∫0π/2​tan(x)​ dx

−−− Demostracioˊn −−−\textcolor{red}{---\text{ Demostración } ---}−−− Demostracioˊn −−−

I={ cot⁡(x) }0π/2(1)2I={ tan⁡x+cot⁡x }0π/2={ cos⁡x+sin⁡xsin⁡(x)cos⁡(x) }0π/2=2{ cos⁡x+sin⁡x1−(sin⁡(x)−cos⁡(x))2 }0π/2(2)=−2{ 11−t2 }−11(3)=−2( arcsin⁡(t) )−11(4)=2π(4)I=π2 \begin{array}{rclr} I &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \sqrt{\cot (x)} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/2} & (1) \\ \\ 2 I &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \sqrt{\tan x} + \sqrt{\cot x} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/2}\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\cos x + \sin x}{\sqrt{\sin(x) \cos(x)}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/2}\\ &=& \displaystyle \sqrt{2} \left\{~ \frac{\cos x + \sin x}{\sqrt{1 - (\sin(x)-\cos(x))^2} } ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/2} & (2)\\ &=& \displaystyle - \sqrt{2} \left\{~ \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - t^2} } ~\right\}_{-1}^{1} & (3)\\ &=& \displaystyle - \sqrt{2} \left(~ \arcsin(t) ~\right)_{-1}^{1} & (4)\\ &=& \displaystyle \sqrt{2} \pi & (4)\\ \\ I &=& \frac{\pi}{\sqrt{2}} \end{array} I2II​========​{ cot(x)​ }0π/2​{ tanx​+cotx​ }0π/2​{ sin(x)cos(x)​cosx+sinx​ }0π/2​2​{ 1−(sin(x)−cos(x))2​cosx+sinx​ }0π/2​−2​{ 1−t2​1​ }−11​−2​( arcsin(t) )−11​2​π2​π​​(1)(2)(3)(4)(4)​

  • (1): {x=π/2−θdx=−dt\left\{\begin{array}{rcl} x &=& \pi/2 - \theta \\ dx &=& -dt \end{array} \right.{xdx​==​π/2−θ−dt​, sin⁡(π/2−x)=cos⁡(x)\sin(\pi/2 - x) = \cos(x)sin(π/2−x)=cos(x) y cos⁡(π/2−x)=sin⁡(x)\cos(\pi/2 - x) = \sin(x)cos(π/2−x)=sin(x)

  • (2): (sin⁡(x)−cos⁡(x))2=1−2sin⁡(x)cos⁡(x)(\sin(x) - \cos(x))^2 = 1 - 2 \sin(x) \cos(x)(sin(x)−cos(x))2=1−2sin(x)cos(x)

  • (3): {t=sin⁡(x)−cos⁡(x)dt=(cos⁡(x)+sin⁡(x)) dx\left\{\begin{array}{rcl} t &=& \sin(x)-\cos(x) \\ dt &=& (\cos(x) + \sin(x) )~dx \end{array} \right.{tdt​==​sin(x)−cos(x)(cos(x)+sin(x)) dx​

  • (4): [arcsin⁡(t)]=11−t2[\arcsin(t)] = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-t^2}}[arcsin(t)]=1−t2​1​

Nota:

  1. Tener cuidado al usar integrales indefinidas pues debemos de determinar sobre que intervalo queremos encontrar la antiderivada.

    Supongamos que x∈(0,π/4)x \in (0, \pi/4)x∈(0,π/4), entonces si queremos de terminar una antiderivada de:

    I={ tan⁡(x) }=−{ cot⁡(θ) } I = \left\{~ \sqrt{\tan (x)} ~\right\} = -\left\{~ \sqrt{\cot (\theta)} ~\right\} I={ tan(x)​ }=−{ cot(θ)​ }

    Sin embargo, al hacer esta sustitución el intervalo de definición de θ∈(π/2,π/4)\theta \in (\pi/2, \pi/4)θ∈(π/2,π/4) y tenemos que:

    2I≠{ tan⁡(x)−cot⁡(θ) } \textcolor{red}{2I \ne \left\{~ \sqrt{\tan (x)} - \sqrt{\cot (\theta)} ~\right\}} 2I={ tan(x)​−cot(θ)​ }

  2. Bibliografía interesante:

    • https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-integral-of-sqrt-tan-x-1/answer/Lai-Johnny?ch=17&oid=229121919&share=bbb0ceb7&srid=CCOmo&target_type=answer

    • https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/409332/calculus-indefinite-integration-find-int-sqrt-cot-x-sqrt-tan-x-dx?noredirect=1

−−− Demostracioˊn −−−\textcolor{red}{---\text{ Demostración } ---}−−− Demostracioˊn −−−

I={ cos⁡(θ)−sin⁡(θ)sin⁡(θ)+cos⁡(θ) }0π/4(1)={ cos⁡(θ)−sin⁡(θ)cos⁡2(θ)−sin⁡2(θ) }0π/4={ cos⁡(θ)cos⁡2(θ)−sin⁡2(θ)−sin⁡(θ)cos⁡2(θ)−sin⁡2(θ) }0π/4={ cos⁡(θ)1−2sin⁡2(θ)−sin⁡(θ)2cos⁡2(θ)−1 }0π/4I1={ cos⁡(θ)1−2sin⁡2(θ) }0π/4={ 11−2t2 }02/2(2)=( arcsin⁡(2t)2 )02/2=π22I2={ −sin⁡(θ)2cos⁡2(θ)−1 }0π/4={ 12t2−1 }2/21(3)=12{ sec⁡(u)tan⁡(u)∣tan⁡(u)∣ }0π/4(4)=12{ sec⁡(u) }0π/4(5)=12( ln⁡(∣tan⁡(u)+sec⁡(u)∣) )0π/4(6)=ln⁡(1+2)2I=π22+ln⁡(1+2)2 \begin{array}{rclr} I &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \sqrt{\frac{\cos(\theta) - \sin(\theta)}{\sin(\theta) + \cos(\theta)}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4} & (1)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\cos(\theta) - \sin(\theta)}{\sqrt{\cos^2(\theta) - \sin^2(\theta)}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4}\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\cos(\theta)}{\sqrt{\cos^2(\theta) - \sin^2(\theta)}} - \frac{\sin(\theta)}{\sqrt{\cos^2(\theta) - \sin^2(\theta)}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4}\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\cos(\theta)}{\sqrt{1 - 2\sin^2(\theta)}} - \frac{\sin(\theta)}{\sqrt{2\cos^2(\theta) - 1}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4}\\\\ I_1 &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{\cos(\theta)}{\sqrt{1 - 2\sin^2(\theta)}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4}\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - 2t^2}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\sqrt{2}/2} & (2)\\ &=& \displaystyle \left(~ \frac{\arcsin(\sqrt{2}t)}{\sqrt{2}} ~\right)_{0}^{\sqrt{2}/2}\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{\pi}{2\sqrt{2}}\\\\ I_2 &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{-\sin(\theta)}{\sqrt{2\cos^2(\theta) - 1}} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4}\\ &=& \displaystyle \left\{~ \frac{1}{\sqrt{2t^2 - 1}} ~\right\}_{\sqrt{2}/2}^{1} & (3)\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left\{~ \frac{\sec(u) \tan(u)}{|\tan (u)|} ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4} & (4)\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left\{~ \sec(u) ~\right\}_{0}^{\pi/4} & (5)\\ &=& \displaystyle \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(~ \ln(|\tan(u) + \sec(u)|)~\right)_{0}^{\pi/4} & (6)\\ &=& \displaystyle \displaystyle \frac{\ln(1 + \sqrt{2})}{\sqrt{2}}\\\\ I &=& \displaystyle \frac{\pi}{2\sqrt{2}} + \frac{\ln(1 + \sqrt{2})}{\sqrt{2}}\\ \end{array} II1​I2​I​===============​{ sin(θ)+cos(θ)cos(θ)−sin(θ)​​ }0π/4​⎩⎨⎧​ cos2(θ)−sin2(θ)​cos(θ)−sin(θ)​ ⎭⎬⎫​0π/4​⎩⎨⎧​ cos2(θ)−sin2(θ)​cos(θ)​−cos2(θ)−sin2(θ)​sin(θ)​ ⎭⎬⎫​0π/4​⎩⎨⎧​ 1−2sin2(θ)​cos(θ)​−2cos2(θ)−1​sin(θ)​ ⎭⎬⎫​0π/4​⎩⎨⎧​ 1−2sin2(θ)​cos(θ)​ ⎭⎬⎫​0π/4​{ 1−2t2​1​ }02​/2​( 2​arcsin(2​t)​ )02​/2​22​π​{ 2cos2(θ)−1​−sin(θ)​ }0π/4​{ 2t2−1​1​ }2​/21​2​1​{ ∣tan(u)∣sec(u)tan(u)​ }0π/4​2​1​{ sec(u) }0π/4​2​1​( ln(∣tan(u)+sec(u)∣) )0π/4​2​ln(1+2​)​22​π​+2​ln(1+2​)​​(1)(2)(3)(4)(5)(6)​

  • (1): {x=π/4−θdx=−dθ\left\{\begin{array}{rcl} x &=& \pi/4 - \theta \\ dx &=& -d\theta \end{array} \right.{xdx​==​π/4−θ−dθ​, sin⁡(π/4−θ)=22(cos⁡(θ)−sin⁡(θ))\sin(\pi/4 - \theta) = \frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}(\cos(\theta)- \sin(\theta))sin(π/4−θ)=22​​(cos(θ)−sin(θ)) y cos⁡(π/4−θ)=22(cos⁡(θ)+sin⁡(θ))\cos(\pi/4 - \theta) = \frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}(\cos(\theta) + \sin(\theta))cos(π/4−θ)=22​​(cos(θ)+sin(θ))

  • (2): {t=sin⁡(θ)dt=cos⁡(θ) dθ\left\{\begin{array}{rcl} t &=& \sin(\theta) \\ dt &=& \cos(\theta)~d\theta \end{array} \right.{tdt​==​sin(θ)cos(θ) dθ​

  • (3): {t=cos⁡(θ)dt=−sin⁡(θ) dθ\left\{\begin{array}{rcl} t &=& \cos(\theta) \\ dt &=& -\sin(\theta)~d\theta \end{array} \right.{tdt​==​cos(θ)−sin(θ) dθ​

  • (4): {2t=sec⁡(u)2 dt=sec⁡(u)tan⁡(u) du\left\{\begin{array}{rcl} \sqrt{2}t &=& \sec (u) \\ \sqrt{2}~dt &=& \sec(u) \tan(u) ~du \end{array} \right.{2​t2​ dt​==​sec(u)sec(u)tan(u) du​

  • (6): sec⁡(u)=sec⁡(u)(tan⁡(u)+sec⁡(u))tan⁡(u)+sec⁡(u)\sec(u) = \frac{\sec(u)(\tan(u) + \sec(u))}{\tan(u) + \sec(u)}sec(u)=tan(u)+sec(u)sec(u)(tan(u)+sec(u))​ y [tan⁡(u)+sec⁡(u)]=sec⁡(u)(tan⁡(u)+sec⁡(u))\left[ \tan(u) + \sec(u) \right] = \sec(u)(\tan(u) + \sec(u))[tan(u)+sec(u)]=sec(u)(tan(u)+sec(u))

Nota:

  1. Para diferentes intervalos de integración tenemos diferentes métodos para integrar la misma función.

∫011+x1+x1+x⋯ dx \int_{0}^{1} \sqrt{1 + x\sqrt{1 + x\sqrt{1 + x\sqrt{\cdots}}}}~dx ∫01​1+x1+x1+x⋯​​​​ dx

−−− Demostracioˊn −−−\textcolor{red}{---\text{ Demostración } ---}−−− Demostracioˊn −−−

Considere la siguiente sucesión:

a1=1+x  ,  an+1=1+xan    para x∈[0,1] a_1 = \sqrt{1+x} ~~,~~ a_{n+1} = \sqrt{1+xa_n} ~~~~\text{para } x \in [0,1] a1​=1+x​  ,  an+1​=1+xan​​    para x∈[0,1]

Veamos que {an}n≥1\{a_n\}_{n \geq 1}{an​}n≥1​ converge para todo x∈[0,1]x \in [0,1]x∈[0,1].

(Monótona Creciente) Usando induccion matemática tenemos que:

a1=1+x≥1a1−1≥0x(a1−1)≥0xa1≥x1+xa1≥1+xa22≥a12a2≥a1 \begin{array}{rclr} a_1 &=& \sqrt{1+x} \\ &\geq& 1 \\ \\ a_1 - 1 &\geq& 0\\ x(a_1 - 1) &\geq& 0\\ xa_1 &\geq& x\\ 1 + xa_1 &\geq& 1 + x\\ a_2^2 &\geq& a_1^2\\ a_2 &\geq& a_1\\ \end{array} a1​a1​−1x(a1​−1)xa1​1+xa1​a22​a2​​=≥≥≥≥≥≥≥​1+x​100x1+xa12​a1​​

Suponiendo que para n∈Nn \in \mathbb{N}n∈N se tiene que an≥an−1a_{n} \geq a_{n-1}an​≥an−1​, entonces:

an≥an−1xan≥xan−11+xan≥1+xan−1an+12≥an2an+1≥an \begin{array}{rclr} a_{n} &\geq& a_{n-1}\\ xa_{n} &\geq& xa_{n-1}\\ 1 + xa_{n} &\geq& 1 + xa_{n-1}\\ a_{n+1}^2 &\geq& a_{n}^2\\ a_{n+1} &\geq& a_{n}\\ \end{array} an​xan​1+xan​an+12​an+1​​≥≥≥≥≥​an−1​xan−1​1+xan−1​an2​an​​

Así pues, la sucesión {an}n≥1\{a_n\}_{n \geq 1}{an​}n≥1​ es monótona creciente.

(Acotada Superiormente) veamos que la sucesión {an}n≥1\{a_n\}_{n \geq 1}{an​}n≥1​ es acotada superiormente por 222. Razonemos por inducción matemática.

Claramente tenemos que a1≤2≤2a_1 \leq \sqrt{2} \leq 2a1​≤2​≤2 pues x∈[0,1]x \in [0,1]x∈[0,1], ahora suponiendo que para n∈Nn \in \mathbb{N}n∈N se tiene que an≤2a_n \leq 2an​≤2, entonces:

an≤2xan≤21+xan≤3an+12≤3an+1≤3≤2 \begin{array}{rclr} a_{n} &\leq& 2 \\ xa_{n} &\leq& 2 \\ 1 + xa_{n} &\leq& 3 \\ a_{n+1}^2 &\leq& 3 \\ a_{n+1} &\leq& \sqrt{3} \\ &\leq& 2 \\ \end{array} an​xan​1+xan​an+12​an+1​​≤≤≤≤≤≤​22333​2​

Así pues, la sucesión {an}n≥1\{a_n\}_{n \geq 1}{an​}n≥1​ es acotada superiormente por 222.

Considere la función f(x)=lim⁡n→∞an(x)f(x) = \lim_{n \to \infty} a_n(x)f(x)=limn→∞​an​(x) para todo x∈[0,1]x \in [0,1]x∈[0,1], esta función esta bien definida pues ya vimos que la sucesión {an}n≥1\{a_n\}_{n \geq 1}{an​}n≥1​ converge para todo x∈[0,1]x \in [0,1]x∈[0,1].
